thread.title: Miami gets commitment from 5-star RB Lorenzo Lingard
thread.title_full: Miami gets commitment from 5-star RB Lorenzo Lingard

author: Zac Al-Khateeb (zac.alkhateeb@sportingnews.com)
title: Miami gets commitment from 5-star RB Lorenzo Lingard
text:
February 9, 2017 6:28pm EST February 9, 2017 6:28pm EST Hurricanes coach Mark Richt is already winning recruiting battles for the 2018 class. Class of 2018 RB Lorenzo Lingard (Greg Oyster) 
Updated at 6:28 p.m. ET 
Updated at 6:28 p.m. ET 
Miami (Fla.) got its first huge commitment of the 2018 recruiting class Thursday with five-star running back Lorenzo Lingard. 
Lingard, the No. 2 running back and No. 15 overall player according to 247Sports Composite rankings , picked the Hurricanes over the likes of Alabama, Ohio State and, more importantly, in-state schools Florida and Florida State. 
MORE: Top 20 signing classes since 2000 
Lingard, in an interview with InsideTheU , said Hurricanes coach Mark Richt and running back coach Thomas Brown were the biggest reasons he chose Miami. 
"Coach Brown is a great dude," Lingard said. "He was a standout type of person to me when I first met him just with his character and everything. Same with Coach Richt. From the time I first met him, he has been the same way." 
The 6-0, 180-pound Lingard, from Orange City, Fla.,Ã‚ anchors a Miami class that ranks second nationally behind Penn State , and first in the Atlantic Coast Conference. Watch This
